description.narrative: WaterStarters is a Water and Health Company. It will increase the access to, and use of, sustainable safe drinking water for communities in rural and peri-urban Kenya, combined with a community-based health program. • Donors, impact investors and national creditors form a blended approach of financing in order to run the Water & Health Company. • The Water & Health Company is responsible for the selection of project sites and the operational management. The company oversees the franchisers. Amref has the executive function to mobilise communities, train community members in maintenance, and train community health workers in the health and hygiene promotion program. • Franchisers are the ones responsible for the day-to-day running of the water point, maintenance, and the revenues generated. Varying per community, a franchisor is either the Water Management Committee (WMC), a private operator within the community, or a private operator outside the community. The franchiser(s) co-invest at least 15% of the total investment.
